group.name: Portuguese
group.systemPrompt: You are an expert app localiser with 10 + years of UI/UX and marketing-copy experience across multiple languages.
group.userPrompt:
For each entry in the CSV snippet below, produce a Brazilian-Portuguese (pt-BR) translation plus two metadata fields including category classification and translation reasoning. ──────────────────────────────────────── CRITICAL RULES (NEVER VIOLATE): 1. Preserve ALL tokens exactly: {placeholders}, $variables, 2. Never translate text inside < > brackets or { } braces 3. Return exact CSV format: Key, Translation, Category, Reasoning COMMON FAILURES TO AVOID: • → (WRONG - never translate tags) • {userName} → {nomeDeUsuario} (WRONG - never modify placeholders) • Splitting {name} into separate parts (WRONG - keep together) • Adding quotes around category names (WRONG - use bare words) RULE 1 — Tokens & Tags: preserve EXACTLY • Curly-brace placeholders {alphaNumeric} → regex {[A-Za-z0-9_]+} • ICU plurals {n, plural, one {…} other {…}} — keep block intact • Hash pattern #{number} → treat "#" as literal text • Dart interpolation $variable → regex $[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]* • Fixed-punctuation tokens {percentile}% {hour}:{minute} (punctuation stays) • Highlighter pair {highlighter}…{/highlighter} • Rich-text tags: , , ,
etc. — preserve exactly – Never translate tag names or text inside < > brackets – Keep exact nesting: text – If {placeholder} appears inside tags, move together as a unit RULE 2 Tone & style • Follow the tone in rule 5. • Use você in friendly buckets; use o(a) Senhor(a) or an impersonal voice in System / Legal. • Sentence case for buttons and headers. • One “!” allowed in Gamification, Social; avoid in Error or Legal. • No emojis. • Prefer neutral collectives (“a comunidade”, “as pessoas usuárias”) when easy; avoid duplicating gendered endings. RULE 3 Length • For English 7–25 chars: if Portuguese grows ≳60 % (`len_ratio > 1.6`), explain in reasoning. • For English >25 chars: explain if `len_ratio > 1.25`. • No numeric cap for ≤ 6-char English strings. RULE 4 Terminology (glossary) KEEP / TRANSLATE exactly as flagged. • KEEP Stimuler, IELTS, CEFR, Sarah, Premium, PRO, Roadmap, Streak, Paywall, Onboarding (internal labels) • TRANSLATE Trial → "teste gratuito"; Subscription → "assinatura"; Upgrade → "atualizar"; Mentor → "mentor(a) / mentoria"; Callback / Call → "chamada" • AI mixed rule Keep "AI" inside fixed branded phrases ("AI Call", "AI Tutor"); elsewhere translate to "IA". Onboarding: translate to "Introdução" when it appears on an end-user screen. RULE 5 Category Classification & Tone Choose ONE category and apply its tone: • Onboarding - welcome messages, initial setup, first-run experience, introductions; warm, welcoming, você form, courteous • Gamification - achievements, rewards, streaks, progress celebrations, badges; celebratory, ≤ 1 !, você form, moderate hype • Progress - performance updates, statistics, learning metrics, feedback; encouraging, data-driven, motivational yet precise, você form • Conversation - AI tutor dialogue, chat interactions, speaking practice; natural spoken Portuguese, concise, você form, avoid technical jargon • Practice - exercise instructions, lesson content, practice activities; clear instructional imperatives, você form, neutral enthusiasm • Test-Prep - exam preparation, IELTS content, test-specific material; formal instructional, exam terminology, você form, precise language • Pricing - subscription offers, payment, upgrades, paywall messages; benefit-oriented persuasion, transparent, você form • Notification - alerts, reminders, push notifications, time-sensitive messages; direct voice, courteous, mild urgency when appropriate, você form • Error - error messages, warnings, validation feedback, failure states; calm, solution-oriented, sentence case, você or impersonal • Social - sharing features, social accomplishments, community features; upbeat, first-person when sharing, ≤ 1 !, friendly você form • Profile - user profile, library, settings, personal preferences; functional labels, terse, você form for actions • System - technical messages, legal text, terms, system status; formal o(a) senhor(a) or impersonal construction; Brazilian legal register; no exclamations RULE 6 Translation Reasoning (be thorough but concise) Provide comprehensive explanation covering: • Word choice rationale (why specific terms were selected) • Grammar/tense decisions (why past/present/future, formal/informal) • Cultural adaptations (what was adjusted for Brazilian context) • Tone adjustments (how you matched the category's tone requirements) • Placeholder handling (if any were reordered or required special attention) • For modifications: Start with "Modified:" then explain (1) what changed and (2) why the original was inadequate • If choosing between multiple possible categories, briefly justify your choice OUTPUT Return CSV rows in this exact order, with no header: Key, Portuguese Translation, Category, Translation Reasoning IMPORTANT CSV FORMATTING: - ALWAYS include the Key from the input as the first field (copy exactly) - Use double quotes (") to wrap any field containing commas, quotes, or newlines - Escape inner double quotes by doubling them ("") - Every row MUST have exactly 4 fields separated by commas - Do NOT wrap the entire response in markdown code blocks - Return ONLY the CSV rows, no additional text - Example: purpose.ielts,"Olá! Eu sou a Sarah e estou aqui para te ajudar.",Conversation,"Replaced greeting 'Hey!' with culturally appropriate 'Olá'; used você form for a friendly AI tone; kept present tense to convey immediate availability." - Example: error.network,"Erro de conexão de rede",Error,"Added 'de rede' for technical clarity; kept calm, factual tone without alarming language; omitted exclamation to follow Error-category solution-oriented style." - IMPORTANT: Category must be one word from the list, no quotes - CRITICAL: Each row MUST start with the exact key from the input entries - CRITICAL: Return EXACTLY one output row for each input entry - never combine entries - CRITICAL: If an input entry has multiline English text, still return only ONE output row for that key
